laboratory_examinations.findings: Albumin level of 3.6 mg per liter (reference range, 0 to 15)

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hematocrit decreased from 36.2% (3 months earlier) to 23.8% on admission.
Creatinine rose from 0.91 mg/dL (8 months earlier) to 10 mg/dL on admission.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Erythropoietin level was 11.4 mIU/mL (reference range, 4.1 to 19.5 for persons with a normal hematocrit and hemoglobin)
Mild proteinuria with a few red and white cells, normoglycemic glycosuria, elevated sodium excretion.
Normal, with no free air under the diaphragm.
Acute and chronic tubular interstitial nephritis, involving 60% of the biopsy specimen.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Original biopsy showed evidence of tubulointerstitial nephritis.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Chronically active tubulointerstitial nephritis with increased fibrosis involving ~80% of interstitium.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Creatinine level declined to 3.4 mg/dL after treatment but later plateaued and began to rise again.
